title: Bartholomew and Matthias
provenance_text:
Karl Ferdinand Friedrich von Nagler [1770-1846], Germany (Lugt 2529) [1]; Kupferstichkabinett der Staatlichen Museen, Berlin, Germany (Lugt 1606 and Lugt 2398) [2]. Charles J. Rosenbloom [1898-1973], Pittsburgh, PA (Lugt Suppl. 633b), until April 1, 1973 [3]; his bequest to Museum of Art, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, February 1974.

Notes:
[1]. Collector's mark on verso.
[2]. The print has both Lugt marks on verso; the museum collection stamp (Lugt 1606) and a stamp for "doubles" (Lugt 2398,) referred to in the literature as "Tilgungsstempel" or de-accession stamp.
[3]. Collector's mark on verso. This is one of a set of seven engravings in Beham's "Christ and the Twelve Apostles" belonging to Mr. Rosenbloom and the only one of the seven to have the collector marks in notes [1] and [2] on verso.

creator.death_place: Frankfurt am Main (Darmstadt district, Hessen state, Germany)
